He had a twisted smile on his face. Laying his head on his worn-out pillow, he thought and thought for a long time. His heart raced, and his mind was a mess. Eventually, he felt trapped in his tiny, yellow room‚Äîit was like being stuck in a box. He needed space. 

Grabbing his hat, he stepped outside, this time without the usual fear of running into anyone; he had completely forgotten about that. He headed toward Vassilyevsky Ostrov, striding down Vassilyevsky Prospect like he was on a mission. But as usual, he wasn‚Äôt really paying attention to where he was going. He muttered to himself, even talking out loud, which caught the attention of people passing by. Many thought he was drunk. üçª

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling stifled and in turmoil, leaves his cramped room to walk aimlessly while muttering to himself.
